rules: Rule1: Provided that a technical interview is scheduled for candidate1, candidate1 is hired.
Rule2: If candidate1 completes the technical interview, then candidate1 meets the requirements.
Rule3: Provided that candidate1 passes the technical interview, if a technical interview is not scheduled for candidate1, an HR interview is not scheduled for candidate1.
Rule4: Whenever candidate1 meets the requirements, candidate1 passes the technical interview.
Rule5: If an offer is extended to candidate1, then the background check does not fail for candidate1.
Rule6: Provided that candidate1 accepts the offer, an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule7: Either candidate1 accepts the offer or candidate1 negotiates the terms.
Rule8: Under the condition that candidate1 attends the job fair, if candidate1 has skill1, then candidate1 is hired.
Rule9: Candidate1 attends the job fair or candidate1 applies for job1.
Rule10: Provided that candidate1 negotiates the terms, candidate1 receives a counter offer.
Rule11: Provided that candidate1 signs the contract, an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule12: Either candidate1 withdraws the application or, if candidate1 receives a counter offer, then candidate1 signs the contract.
Rule13: References are checked for candidate1 or candidate1 is hired.
Rule14: The manager approves candidate1 or HR approves candidate1.
Rule15: Whenever HR approves candidate1, if references are checked for candidate1, then references are positive for candidate1.

Rule16: Provided that director approval is given for candidate1, if the manager approves candidate1, then under the condition that references are checked for candidate1, references are positive for candidate1.
Rule17: Director approval is given for candidate1 or VP approval is given for candidate1.
Rule18: Provided that candidate1 has a duplicate application, applications are merged for candidate1.
Rule19: If candidate1 has a duplicate application, then the application is not valid for candidate1.
Rule20: Under the condition that applications are merged for candidate1, the application is valid for candidate1.
Rule21: If salary is discussed with candidate1, then provided that candidate1 negotiates the terms, an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule22: Whenever benefits are discussed with candidate1, if candidate1 negotiates the terms, then an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule23: Provided that compensation is negotiated with candidate1, salary is discussed with candidate1 or benefits are discussed with candidate1.
Rule24: Compensation is negotiated with candidate1 or a package is presented to candidate1.
Rule25: Under the condition that a package is presented to candidate1, salary is discussed with candidate1 or benefits are discussed with candidate1.
Rule26: If a start date is agreed with candidate1, then provided that candidate1 receives a counter offer, candidate1 signs the contract.
Rule27: A start date is agreed with candidate1 or onboarding is scheduled for candidate1.
Rule28: Under the condition that orientation is complete for candidate1, provided that candidate1 receives a counter offer, candidate1 signs the contract.
Rule29: Provided that training is assigned to candidate1, orientation is complete for candidate1.
Rule30: If there is an application conflict for candidate1, then the conflict is cleared for candidate1.
Rule31: Provided that there is an application conflict for candidate1, the application is not resolved for candidate1.
Rule32: Under the condition that the conflict is cleared for candidate1, the application is resolved for candidate1.
Rule33: If relocation is offered to candidate1, then provided that candidate1 receives a counter offer, an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule34: Relocation is offered to candidate1 or a remote option is available for candidate1.
Rule35: Relocation is accepted by candidate1 or remote work is accepted by candidate1.
Rule36: If remote work is accepted by candidate1, then provided that a remote option is available for candidate1, whenever candidate1 receives a counter offer, an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule37: Under the condition that there is a background discrepancy for candidate1, the discrepancy is resolved for candidate1.
Rule38: Provided that there is a background discrepancy for candidate1, the discrepancy is verified for candidate1.

Rule39: Either there is a background discrepancy for candidate1 or, if it is not the case that whenever relocation is accepted by candidate1 and a remote option is available for candidate1 and candidate1 receives a counter offer, then an offer is extended to candidate1, a work arrangement is not set for candidate1.
Rule40: If candidate1 passes the screening, then candidate1 is not rejected.
Rule41: Provided that the discrepancy is verified for candidate1, the discrepancy is not resolved for candidate1.

Rule42: Under the condition that a legal review is conducted for candidate1, if it is not the case that whenever candidate1 receives a counter offer, candidate1 signs the contract, then the contract is not valid for candidate1.

Rule43: If compliance approval is granted for candidate1, then provided that it is not the case that candidate1 receives a counter offer implies candidate1 signs the contract, the contract is not valid for candidate1.
Rule44: Provided that final approval is given for candidate1, hiring is not complete for candidate1.
Rule45: Final approval is given for candidate1 or a legal review is conducted for candidate1 or compliance approval is granted for candidate1.
Rule46: If employment starts for candidate1, then under the condition that final approval is given for candidate1, hiring is complete for candidate1.
Rule47: The offer expires for candidate1 or the offer is active for candidate1.
Rule48: Provided that the offer is active for candidate1, if candidate1 negotiates the terms, then an offer is extended to candidate1.
Rule49: If the offer is withdrawn from candidate1, then candidate1 declines.
Rule50: Whenever recruitment is successful for candidate1, provided that a replacement is hired for candidate1, the position is filled for candidate1.
Rule51: If candidate1 has experience, then job1 is an entry-level position.
Rule52: If job1 is a senior position, then job1 is not an entry-level position.
Rule53: Under the condition that it is not the case that candidate1 receives a counter offer implies candidate1 signs the contract, the contract is valid for candidate1.

Rule54: If it is not the case that VP approval is given for candidate1 implies that if the manager approves candidate1, then whenever references are checked for candidate1, references are positive for candidate1, then candidate1 has a duplicate application.
Rule55: Whenever it is not the case that candidate1 applies for job1 implies that if candidate1 has skill1, then candidate1 is hired, candidate1 is rejected.
Rule56: Provided that it is not the case that onboarding is scheduled for candidate1 implies training is assigned to candidate1, there is an application conflict for candidate1.

Rule57: If it is not the case that relocation is accepted by candidate1 implies that if a remote option is available for candidate1 and candidate1 receives a counter offer, then an offer is extended to candidate1, a work arrangement is set for candidate1.
Rule58: Provided that it is not the case that candidate1 has experience implies job1 is a senior position, candidate1 has insufficient experience.

Rule59: Under the condition that it is not the case that it is not the case that the offer expires for candidate1 implies the offer is withdrawn from candidate1 implies recruitment is closed for candidate1, a replacement is hired for candidate1.
Rule60: Provided that it is not the case that candidate1 is not hired implies a background check is not initiated for candidate1, the background check fails for candidate1.
Rule61: If a technical interview is not scheduled for candidate1, then an HR interview is scheduled for candidate1.
Rule62: Whenever candidate1 does not pass the screening, candidate1 fails the screening.
Rule63: If candidate1 is not hired, then a background check is initiated for candidate1.
Rule64: Under the condition that candidate1 is not hired, candidate1 has experience.
facts: Fact2: Candidate1 completes the technical interview.
Fact4: Recruitment is successful for candidate1.
Fact5: It is not the case that candidate1 has insufficient experience.
Fact6: Candidate1 does not withdraw the application.
Fact7: References are not positive for candidate1.
Fact9: Candidate1 does not fail the screening.
Fact10: Recruitment is not closed for candidate1.
Fact11: The position is not filled for candidate1.
